text: Holland Green Linear Park is a scenic park located in Singapore, known for its beautifully landscaped greenery and tranquil environment. This park is part of the larger efforts to create green spaces within the city, providing residents and visitors with a place for relaxation, jogging, and leisurely walks. The park is designed with a linear layout, featuring well-maintained paths, lush trees, and various plants, making it a perfect spot for nature lovers and those looking to escape the bustle of the city. It’s also a popular spot for families and fitness enthusiasts.

Holland Green Linear Park is a stretch of narrow green space running parallel to Bukit Timah Diversion Canal.
This Diversion canal was constructed to divert rainwater away from Bukit Timah into Pandan River to alleviate flood condition at Bukit Timah area.
The Park can be access from Garlick Ave, and from Blackmore Drive.
At the eastern end of the Park is a Playground. Next to it along Holland Plain is an exercise corner.
On the western end is the Bukit Timah Diversion Canal Wetlands with sediment pool and vegetation to cleanse the water.
A man-made Cascading waterfall can be seen at the Diversion Canal.
The Holland Green Linear Park western end connect up to the Rail Corridor.
There is a very big field parallel to this Linear Park where people are seen flying drones, run their dogs.
The big field was a former Hakka burial ground called Fung Yun Thai Cemetery (丰永大坟山) that was exhumed in the early eighties.
This serene Park is a great place to walk, jog, cycle, walk the dog; or just simply enjoy its tranquility.

This is a nice little park that is part of the park connector and is usually serenely calm. Even though this park can lead to the rail green corridor, there are not much people that will take the side track to come here. Hope that it will stay this way and not become rowdy if more people discovered this place.
Very interesting park, the road is smooth and suitable for cycling. There are few people even on weekends. However, there are few places to shade. Remember to put on sunscreen or take an umbrella.
Nice quiet and big open space to walk, go for a run. Hope it connects to other park connectors soon, then it will become very interesting in with the mountain bike!
